titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Fales Library and Special Collections Audio/Video Collection
1960-2011
MSS.306
titlestmt.author: Ashley Todd, 2011.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-12-14 09:09:52 -0500.

change.item: Additional series (Data Storage and Film) and new material added by Kelly Haydon and Christine Gennetti

did.unittitle: Fales Library and Special Collections Audio/Video Collection

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into four series by format and arranged alphabetically by title. The dates used are the items' copyright years.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Fales Library and Special Collection Audio/Video Collection; MSS 306; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Series I, II, and III are to researchers. Series IV: Film, is closed. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains primarily commerically released audio and video materials relating to the Fales Library and Special Collections.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Access to audiovisual materials in this collection is available through digitized access copies. Researchers may view an item's original container, but the media themselves are not available for playback because of preservation concerns. Materials that have already been digitized are noted in the collection's finding aid and can be requested in our reading room.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains audio materials on audiocassette and CD including audiobooks, readings and interviews.

did.unittitle: LeRoi Jones at Panther Benefit, Fillmore East

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Amiri Baraka (LeRoi Jones) gives a 15-minute address to an audience of Black Panther supporters, an event held at the Fillmore East in New York City, 1968.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Track 1: Men discuss the cultural concerns of their day. Beat Generation figures are mentioned (Jack Kerouac, Neal Cassady and Allen Ginsberg).
Track 2: Radio broadcasts of news and music (jazz, pop and classical).

did.unittitle: Landing Signals, An Anthology of Sacramento Poets
